lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the needed import to make the component work as expected.

Make sure to type import React.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is required to let other files access a component?

Using export default or using named exportsUsing import statementCreating a .js fileNaming the file the same as the component

Using export default or using named exports.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following is true about importing React?

It is necessary for any file that uses JSXIt is not required in class componentsIt can be omitted if the component is not exportedIt should be imported more than once per project

It is necessary for any file that uses JSX.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following imports the Footer component correctly?

import Footer from "./Footer";import Footer from "Footer.js";export Footer from "./Footer";require Footer "./Footer";

import Footer from "./Footer";.

lessons.title: Lesson #2 - Copy - Copy  - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create the JSX to render a paragraph.

Make sure to pick <p>, followed by </p>.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the App component from the App.jsx file.

Make sure to type import App from "./App".

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following statements is true about React components?

React components can be reused multiple times in the applicationReact components cannot be reused after they are utilized onceReact components can only return one HTML element and should not wrap themReact components cannot be nested within each other

React components can be reused multiple times in the application.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import a single named component to use in your React application to render it.

Make sure to type { Hero }.

lessons.title: Lesson #11
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the Footer component a default export and include a named export Copyright.

Make sure to pick export const, followed by export default.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the benefit of having each component in its own file?

It keeps the project organized and cleanIt makes the project run fasterIt increases the size of each fileIt causes errors during runtime

It keeps the project organized and clean.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code do?

It imports and uses the Navbar component in AppIt exports the Navbar componentIt creates a new h2 elementIt renders an external script

It imports and uses the Navbar component in App.

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Generate and export a component named Header.

Make sure to pick const followed by Header and then export, default, Header.

lessons.title: Lesson #13 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a div with an id that matches the value expected by index.jsx to render the React app.

Make sure to pick <div id="start">, followed by loading, and finally </div>.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the Greeting component and render it inside the App component.

Make sure to pick import followed by Greeting and then from, "./Greeting", <, Greeting, /, >.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Render the Greeting component.

Make sure to type <Greeting />.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a multi-line JSX to render both the Character and Greeting components.

Make sure to pick return followed by ( and then <div>, </div>, ).

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
If the import statement for multiple named exports is correct, what will this code render?

A witch and a wizard characterOnly a witch characterOnly a wizard characterAn error due to a syntax issue

A witch and a wizard character.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the Nav component the default export in Nav.jsx.

Make sure to pick export, followed by default, and finally Nav.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create another component named Footer that returns an HTML string.

Make sure to pick const followed by Footer and then =, (, ), =>, {, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make sure the file begins with the correct import statement.

Make sure to pick import followed by React and then from, "react", ;.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
Identify the JSX code that returns a heading from the Header component.

<header>Site Title</header>import React from "react"const Header = () => {}No part does that

<header>Site Title</header>.

lessons.title: Lesson #14 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we need to import createRoot?

We import createRoot to set up the place where React will render our componentWe import createRoot because it automatically renders the entire webpageWe import createRoot because it handles the entire page layoutWe import createRoot because it loads all components at once

We import createRoot to set up the place where React will render our component.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to correctly return the elements.

Make sure to pick <div>, followed by </div>.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Look at the following code and determine which is the correct way to import a React component?

import Animal from "./Animal";require Animal from "./Animal";import "./Animal" as Animal;Hero = "./Animal";

import Animal from "./Animal";.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which statement about named exports is correct?

They allow importing specific components from a fileThey require all components to be imported at onceThey can only be used in index filesThey require special syntax to use in the return statement

They allow importing specific components from a file.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the correct way to import just the named export Video from Media.jsx?

import { Video } from "./Media"import Video from "./Media"import { default as Video } from "./Media"import "./Media" as Video

import { Video } from "./Media".

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the import statement to import the Article component from the Article.jsx file.

Make sure to type import Article from.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
If Icon is a default export, what is the proper way to import it in a file?

import Icon from "./Icon"import { Icon } from "./Icon"import "./Icon"import { default } from "./Icon"

import Icon from "./Icon".
